indications: Indications symptomatic treatment of acute exacerbations of chronic bronchitis
name: ERDOSTEINE
cautions:
Cautions 
(From 3.7 Mucolytics: British National Formulary)
Mucolytics should be used with caution in those with a history of peptic ulceration because they may disrupt the gastric mucosal barrier.
side-effects:
Side-effects very rarely nausea, vomiting,
diarrhoea, abdominal pain, taste disturbance, headache, rash, and
urticaria
doses:
adult over 18 years, 300 mg
twice daily for up to 10 days
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid—no information available
